Replace.Text: Bell +2 [ICON_Gold] coins for each unique area and luxury resource in the destination city of the international trade route. The bank and the factory provide Bell +1 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points and +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points respectively. Oil wells and offshore oil rigs that develop [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] oil resources have an additional +3 [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] oil resource accumulation per turn.

+5 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing. +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] technology per adjacent strategic resource. Must be built on flat terrain. +2 [ICON_Power] power supply for the current city. Cannot be built next to another Gas Station.

Instead of workshops, provide [ICON_Gold] gold equal to the adjacency bonus of industrial areas. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for international trade routes from this city, +2 [ICON_Production] Production for domestic trade routes.
Bell is a modern characteristic light cavalry unit with wider vision. Escort civilians or support units with high mobility. A gas station can be built. Upgrade to a helicopter.

Purchase units and buildings with [ICON_Gold] coins cost 20% less. Converts a military policy slot in the current government to an economic policy slot. The time to build commercial centers and industrial estates has been halved.
